dialogues.text: But you're a sorcerer.

dialogues.speaker: GALEN
dialogues.text: I'm no sorcerer. Whatever power | might have had, it's gone.

dialogues.speaker: VALERIAN
dialogues.text: It can't be!

dialogues.speaker: GALEN
dialogues.text: | know: I'm an imposter. A fraud. A fake. I'm sorry... Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  For a moment, Valerian is too stunned to speak. Then her face colors.

dialogues.speaker: VALERIAN
dialogues.text: You're sorry?! Listen to that! The damn thing is loose, we're all on fire and you're sorry! Galen sinks to the floor and sits in the ashes.

dialogues.speaker: VALERIAN
dialogues.text: You didn't have the faintest idea what you were doing, did you? You're a fool вЂ” and I'm a bigger one for bringing you here. She snatches up a pitchfork and glowers at him.

dialogues.speaker: VALERIAN
dialogues.text: | don't want you in this house. Get out. But Galen still sits there like a puppet with its strings cut, every dream of glory utterly crushed. This piteous s touches Valerian's heart. Her gaze softens. She slowly lo the pitchfork.

dialogues.speaker: TOWN SQUARE
dialogues.text: A knot of villagers lead Tyrian and his henchmen across t square directly to the blacksmith's shop. The King's men dismount and pound on the door. It swings open. Valerian standing there.

dialogues.speaker: TYRIAN
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: VALERIAN
dialogues.text: Not here. | can't help you. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca Acry goes up from the villagers. They know damn well he' in there.

dialogues.speaker: VALERIAN'S HOUSE
dialogues.text: Tyrian pushes Valerian aside and steps into the room. Aid by some townfolk, his men proceed to ransack the premises overturning barrels, sticking their swords through flour sacks, poking through the tumbledown thatch. Valerian's e falls on Malkin, who has involved himself in the search.

dialogues.speaker: VALERIAN
dialogues.text: You too?

dialogues.speaker: MALKIN
dialogues.text: (returning her look) Damn right. Finding nothing, the group pushes into the metal shop, wh Simon is hammering an iron wheel rim back into shape on a enormous anvil. He lays down his tools and grimly watches the men go through, overturning benches and tables. Tyria props a leg up on the anvil and addresses himself to Simo

dialogues.speaker: TYRIAN
dialogues.text: As the proud new father of an eligible daughter who was some-how overlooked all these years, it may interest you to know that the King has called for a new lottery.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: But it's months til the solstice.

dialogues.speaker: TYRIAN
dialogues.text: In view of what's happened, we all know what's required.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: I've never taken part in your cursed lottery, and I'll have nothing to do with it now.

dialogues.speaker: TYRIAN
dialogues.text: You were very clever. But she'll Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  take part, like all the rest. No exceptions. The search party has exhausted the room's hiding places.

dialogues.speaker: HENCHMAN
dialogues.text: Nothing. If he was here, he's gone now. Tyrian nods and leads the way out. Simon catches up and p Tyrian aside at the door.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: All right. | know what you want. How much?

dialogues.speaker: TYRIAN
dialogues.text: Are you offering me a bribe?

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: TYRIAN
dialogues.text: Don't waste your time. (pause) You could never afford it. He spins on his heel and joins his men as they ride out o town. Valerian and Simon watch them go. When the riders a out of sight, they return to the shop. With a couple of s poles, they strain to lift the anvil off its base. Finall it topples over. Valerian slides the base aside, revealin trap door. She raises it and a cramped Galen unfolds hims from the space below. On his face is a curious look of determination.

dialogues.speaker: GALEN
dialogues.text: Smith вЂ”have you ever forged a weapon?

dialogues.speaker: WEAPONS
dialogues.text: Simon is going through a cabinet, tossing out hoes, rakes sickles, scythes, plow blades, and a knife or two. Galen examines them doubtfully. Now Simon produces an armload o Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca swords. Galen is impressed; he looks them over carefully testing and rejecting them in turn.

dialogues.speaker: GALEN
dialogues.text: These are your sharpest? Simon plucks up one of the swords, carries it to the cent of the room. He lays a horseshoe on the anvil. He brings sword down вЂ” whack! вЂ” and cuts the horseshoe in half.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Even Tyrian carries one of these. Galen hefts it dubiously.

dialogues.speaker: GALEN
dialogues.text: It's sharp вЂ” but it's not sharp enough. Valerian has been watching all this with growing concern.

dialogues.speaker: VALERIAN
dialogues.text: Not sharp enough for what?

dialogues.speaker: GALEN
dialogues.text: For what I'm going to do with it.

dialogues.speaker: VALERIAN
dialogues.text: Nothing's that sharp. Simon gnaws his lip. Reluctantly, he brings a long box fr the bottom of the cabinet. He opens it. Lying on a bed of silk is an exquisite two-handed broadsword. The flat blad gleams like a mirror. Galen reaches in and lifts it out.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: The best | ever made. Valerian is as awed as Galen.

dialogues.speaker: VALERIAN
dialogues.text: I's beautiful. Galen brings up a finger to test the edge. Simon grabs hi hand away. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do that! (he looks at Valerian) Girl-child, when you were born | knew | had to do something, so | set about the task of fashioning an extraordinary weapon: | had the skill to make it вЂ” (bleak pause) вЂ” but not the nerve to use it. She looks at him with affection. Leaning forward, she pla a kiss on his bald pate.

dialogues.speaker: VALERIAN
dialogues.text: I'm thankful for that. (to Galen) No man should choose a senseless death.

dialogues.speaker: STREAM
dialogues.text: Galen, Valerian and Simon tramp through a glade to a moss bank. There a wide stream flows lazily under a canopy of trees.

dialogues.speaker: VALERIAN
dialogues.text: If it's me you're worried about, don't. So my name has been entered, what of it? There are hundreds of girls. My name just won't be drawn. | know it won't. Galen walks out into the shallows and pushes the sword-ti into the sandy bottom, angled so that the edge splits the current.

dialogues.speaker: GALEN
dialogues.text: Valerian, this isn't just for your sake. He walks back to shore. All three watch the sword to see Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  what will happen.

dialogues.speaker: SWORD
dialogues.text: Big flat oak leaves are gliding along the current. Very slowly, they go by the sword, some of them very close. Finally, one of them floats against the leading edge of t blade and without a ripple is cleft in two. Simon gives G a significant look.

dialogues.speaker: VALERIAN
dialogues.text: | don't care. It doesn't matter. What you want to kill isn't flesh and blood.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Oh, it'll bleed, all right.

dialogues.speaker: VALERIAN
dialogues.text: How do you know? No one's so much as even scratched it. They look to Galen. The apprentice's face is full of doub

dialogues.speaker: GALEN
dialogues.text: I'l need the amulet.

dialogues.speaker: KING'S CASTLE
dialogues.text: Carrying torches to light their way, families - some with maiden daughters вЂ” gather from all over the country in courtyard of the King's castle. Simon is there with Valer and so is Galen, disguised in rough farm clothes and a wi brimmed hat. Like many others, he carries a stick topped with a bleached skull вЂ” to all appearances, just anothe participant in this weird pagan ritual. A barrel decorate with flames and dragon's wings sits on a raised dais in f of the main entrance. Horsrik, the King's herald, supervi preparations for the lottery. Armed guards appear carryin sealed chest. Horsrik breaks the seal and the guards pour the contents вЂ” hundreds of wooden tiles, each bearing t name of a potential sacrifice вЂ” into the barrel. Trumpe blare and drums roll and the royal party strolls onstage: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca the King, his daughter, courtiers and Tyrian. Valerian n Galen.

dialogues.speaker: VALERIAN
dialogues.text: (pointing) Look at her. The Princess.

dialogues.speaker: GALEN
dialogues.text: | know. We've met. Valerian gives Galen a sharp look. Horsrik unrolls a parchment.

dialogues.speaker: HORSRIK
dialogues.text: (reading) People of Urland: whereas the peace of the kingdom has been disrupted by the mischief of an interloper; and whereas this interloper being fled; now therefore, his majesty the King hereby proclaims the sum of thirty ducats to be paid to anyone producing the miscreant Galen Bradwardyn, fraud enchanter, to our satisfaction. Galen pulls his hat low over his eyes. As the moment for drawing approaches, Valerian becomes more and more uneasy She pushes forward through the crowd until she's just bel the barrel. She eyes the people around her. Some of them seem equally worried, others вЂ” the better dressed and b fed вЂ” are smug and complacent. The King and his retinue serene. A chant goes up from the crowd:

dialogues.speaker: CROWD
dialogues.text: Stir the tiles! Stir the tiles! Horsrik picks up a wooden staff surmounted by a carved dragon's head and stirs up the names. This done, a new ch goes up:

dialogues.speaker: CROWD
dialogues.text: Bare the arm! Bare the arm! At a signal, a guard comes forward and cuts the sleeve fr Horsrik's right arm. He holds it high. The crowd surges Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  forward. The atmosphere is full of dread and excitement. Valerian looking pale and determined, is jostled and push to the edge of the platform.

dialogues.speaker: CROWD
dialogues.text: Draw the name! Draw the name! The moment has come. Down goes Horsrik's arm and up it co holding one little wooden square, one young woman's fate. expectant hush falls over the mob. The virgins of Urland tremble and wait.

dialogues.speaker: HORSRIK
dialogues.text: Now, my countrymen, hear me: behold, for lam chosen. | shall die that many may live. I shall lay down my life for family and fellows. | shall go to my grave for the love of our King and his wise policy. And my name is вЂ” He looks down at the tile to read the name, but no sound comes to his lips. He looks back at the crowd, a cold swe breaking over his face. He swallows, but still can't brin himself to speak. At his feet, Valerian is holding her br Anew chant goes up.

dialogues.speaker: CROWD
dialogues.text: The name! The name! By now Horsrik is trembling. He stares down at the tile, mouth set in a grim line. The King is getting annoyed. He gestures and the crowd falls silent.

dialogues.speaker: KING
dialogues.text: Read the name.

dialogues.speaker: HORSRIK
dialogues.text: (mastering himself) The name is: Princess Elspeth Ulfilas, filia regis. There is a moment of profound shock. Then a low murmur of wonder moves through the crowd. Galen looks at Valerian; sags with relief. The King turns to his daughter. She sho Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca nothing. He rises from his chair, comes forward and snat the tile from Horsrik.

dialogues.speaker: KING
dialogues.text: That's not the name. It's been misread. Valerian will not stand for such hypocrisy.

dialogues.speaker: VALERIAN
dialogues.text: There's no mistake! The name's been chosen - let it stand!

dialogues.speaker: KING
dialogues.text: No, the good Horsrik has misspoke himself. (he looks at the tile) In fairness to this individual, whose name I can't make out, we'll destroy this tile. He quickly tosses the wood chip into a brazier at his elb Led by Valerian, the crowd cries out in protest.

dialogues.speaker: VALERIAN
dialogues.text: No! What better name than your own kin? At last we see justice done!

dialogues.speaker: KING
dialogues.text: Silence! We will have a new choosing. | will draw the name myself. He reaches into the barrel and extracts another tile. He looks at it and his eyes widen. Betrayed, he swivels to f his daughter. The din of the crowd reaches a crescendo.

dialogues.speaker: CROWD
dialogues.text: Let it stand! Let it stand! Elspeth takes the tile from her father's nerveless finger looks at it with satisfaction and holds it aloft.

dialogues.speaker: ELSPETH
dialogues.text: The name is as you heard it and as Horsrik read it: Elspeth. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  The King moils through the tiles, finding his daughter's name again and again.

dialogues.speaker: KING
dialogues.text: The lottery is invalid. Another and another. What treachery is this? Valerian, chanting with the rest, falls silent. She looks Elspeth with sudden interest and respect, then awe.

dialogues.speaker: ELSPETH
dialogues.text: Hear me, good people! It is true, that my name appears on many of the lots. This does not falsify the drawing, it certifies it! | have learned that my name has been kept from jeopardy in all the drawings in the past. So Ihave put my name among the rest many times вЂ” once for each risk that, over the years, you took and | did not. The crowd is dumbfounded. Gradually voices erupt ina cacophony of shouts, whistles and excited conversation. G sees his chance: there's an unguarded door near the stabl He drifts toward it and slips inside.

dialogues.speaker: THRONE ROOM
dialogues.text: Galen pokes his head in: the room is empty. He scurries o to a chest, flings it open and starts rummaging. Finding nothing he moves on to a cabinet. He breaks the lock and pries it open. Again, nothing.

dialogues.speaker: CASTLE CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Galen can hear the voices in the courtyard as he rushes d a hall. Suddenly he stops short. There in front of him is guard leaning out a window to watch the proceedings. Gale hovers on the verge of panic as the guard abruptly moves. But the man is only headed for another window and a bette view. Galen manages to fall into step an arm's length beh him and slip by without a sound. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen enters the library, his enormous shadow dancing cra on the torchlit walls. Hurrying through, his attention is drawn to some open books on a table. Closer inspection re magical writings and symbols. Galen paws over everything, suddenly aware that he must be close to the amulet. But w is it?

dialogues.speaker: COURTYARD
dialogues.text: As the crowd disperses Valerian watches Elspeth walk back the castle, lofty and composed. She looks for Galen and discovers he has gone.

dialogues.speaker: LIBRARY
dialogues.text: By now, the room is in total disarray. Galen has opened a the chests and trunks and knocked half the books from the shelves. No amulet. He's feverishly working on a locked d when a voice interrupts him.

dialogues.speaker: KING
dialogues.text: Don't go to all that trouble. Galen whirls around to find the King standing in the door The monarch looks shattered. Galen edges toward the split the wall and finds that it has been shored up with timber At that moment Tyrian comes through the door, sizes up th situation and draws his sword.

dialogues.speaker: GALEN
dialogues.text: I'm unarmed. If you want a fight, at least give me a weapon.

dialogues.speaker: TYRIAN
dialogues.text: (pushing by the King) | think not!

dialogues.speaker: KING
dialogues.text: Stop! Don't harm him. (to Galen) And you вЂ” don't run away... please... The King's voice is cracking. Galen and Tyrian are equall Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca taken aback. The King searches through the books remaini on the library shelves.

dialogues.speaker: KING
dialogues.text: (shaky) I've always had the greatest admiration for the black arts. You chaps with your mysterious spells... | didn't think it would be necessary, you see. Vermithrax is an old dragon. And that, | thought, was the beauty of my plan вЂ” buying time. We'd wait her out. I'd live to see the end of her. (firm) That's still going to happen. The King finds the book and takes the amulet out. With trembling hands, he passes it to Galen.

dialogues.speaker: TYRIAN
dialogues.text: Sire!

dialogues.speaker: KING
dialogues.text: He shall have it. (pleading) It's my daughter. Save her, | beg you.

dialogues.speaker: VILLAGE
dialogues.text: The people of Swanscombe are clearing up the rubble and beginning repairs on their dwellings. Standing in their m lecturing every passerby, is Greil. He holds up the charr remains of Brother Jacopus' wooden cross.

dialogues.speaker: GREIL
dialogues.text: Holy of holies вЂ” he did not die in vain. Can you hear me, brothers? Some workmen go by lugging new thatch. Malkin is with the

dialogues.speaker: MALKIN
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  (gently) We hear you, Greil.

dialogues.speaker: GREIL
dialogues.text: Well and good, but I'm Greil no longer. Call me Gregorius, after the Bishop of Rome. Malkin and the others stop to listen.

dialogues.speaker: GREIL
dialogues.text: I saw him die. Like Our Lord Jesus on the cross he was, scourged by evil. But he showed no fear. Such is the power of the Holy Ghost.

dialogues.speaker: BLACKSMITH SHOP
dialogues.text: Galen lurks in the shadows of Simon's metal shop looking on the square where Greil is holding forth.

dialogues.speaker: GREIL
dialogues.text: Of what avail is magic? The old gods died with our daughters. From whence comest my help? My help comest from the Lord! Galen quietly shuts and bars the door. He moves deeper in the gloomy workroom where Simon is pumping a bellows to h up the forge. Galen looks at the coals.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Good and hot.

dialogues.speaker: GALEN
dialogues.text: Don't bother. That's not the kind of fire we need. Valerian is staring at the sword, sitting on the anvil in its silk wrapping. Galen uncovers it, holds it high, and puts his hand on the amulet.

dialogues.speaker: GALEN
dialogues.text: Nunc, per Potestatem Hermeticum вЂ” ex flammis, ferrum sangrinarium! Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca The sword starts to hum and to heat up. From the hilt ou the blade glows brighter and brighter: red, orange, white It lights up the room, throwing long shadows into the cor Galen lays the white hot steel on the anvil. Simon takes his hammer and begins the reforging. Valerian sees their resolve. After watching for several moments she slips out the side door, looking sad.

dialogues.speaker: DRAGON COUNTRY
dialogues.text: Clouds scud low over the lifeless region. The dragon's la now has a newer, bigger entrance. Vapors drift upward fro it. Down the slope a lonely figure works its way from roc to rock: it's Valerian with a wicker basket on her arm, searching for dragon scales. The basket is already more t half full when she finds herself ominously near the mouth the cavern. She's about to turn back when she spies a particularly large and beautiful scale just a few yards further on. As she reaches for it, there is a sudden hiss She jerks her hand back and freezes. There in the shadows a baby dragon, a basilisk, all coppery bronze with stubby winglets. As she backs away, she sees two more come up to join the first. They watch her retreat through wicked lit green eyes.

dialogues.speaker: STREAM
dialogues.text: On the mossy bank Galen and Simon unwrap the reforged swo Now the blade carries a faint blue halation. Galen walks the middle of the current and once again stabs the tip do into the sand. Then he rejoins Simon onshore to await res This time, as the oak leaves approach the sharp edge, the gently but definitely veer sideways to avoid contact. Suc is the power of the sword that even after many leaves, no single one has come close enough to be sliced. Simon is a and even Galen seems satisfied. They clasp hands.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: An edge like no other on this earth. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well done, Simon. Thank you. Simon hands him a bundle of fighting equipment.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: (grave) I'l say goodbye to Valerian for you. I'm sorry she's not here, but you know how she is.

dialogues.speaker: GALEN
dialogues.text: l understand. They look at each other for what could be the last time.

dialogues.speaker: SIMON
dialogues.text: Fare thee well. The old man departs. Galen unfolds the bundle and brings its contents: mail hauberk with coif, studded leather glo padded jerkin, a scabbard and a small wooden shield. He l them out on the stream bank, then strips off his tunic an kneels down to splash some water in his face. As the cups the water between his hands, an image comes alive and shi on the surface: Valerian, stripping off her own clothes, shyly turning toward him, solemn and romantic.

dialogues.speaker: VALERIAN
dialogues.text: Galen. It's as if the vision is speaking to him, but it's not. H spins around and sees her standing there, fully clothed, possessed of a brisk and businesslike air.

dialogues.speaker: VALERIAN
dialogues.text: Here. She throws down a shield. It's remarkable in its construc overlapping layers of iridescent dragon scales have been ingeniously fastened to a leather-clad frame.

dialogues.speaker: VALERIAN
dialogues.text: It's a shield. | made it. Might keep the fire off you. Might not. You Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  know, you're an idiot. You're going to die tonight. You'll be ripped limb from limb. This is the last time I'll ever speak to you. Galen turns the shield over and over, marveling at it. He fixes her with a piercing look.

dialogues.speaker: GALEN
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: VALERIAN
dialogues.text: (rushing) Another thing. That thing isn't alone up there. There's little ones. Young, I think. | don't know how many. She shudders. Galen's eyes are still fastened on her. She fighting to retain her hard manner, but the agitation and dread are plain.

dialogues.speaker: GALEN
dialogues.text: Hatchlings. They'll have to be killed too. Anything else? Valerian wants to be bold, but on this final point, can't muster the courage.

dialogues.speaker: VALERIAN
dialogues.text: (tiny voice) You're in love, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: GALEN
dialogues.text: (slowly nodding) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: VALERIAN
dialogues.text: That's all right. | understand. She's very beautiful, very brave.

dialogues.speaker: GALEN
dialogues.text: Who is? What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: VALERIAN
dialogues.text: Your Princess. But | don't care. It Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  doesn't change the way | feel. (firm) Listen to me, Galen Bradwardyn, sorcerer's apprentice; you're going to be dead, the dragon will be worse than ever, there will be more lotteries, and I'm not a boy any more.

dialogues.speaker: GALEN
dialogues.text: And you'll be eligible because вЂ”

dialogues.speaker: VALERIAN
dialogues.text: Because I'm still a virgin, and | want you to do something about it. Galen takes her in his arms; she is trembling. He tilts h face up toward his and kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: GALEN
dialogues.text: lam in love. But not with the Princess. Their image is reflected in the waters. Through the rippl she is visible pulling briefly away to remove her clothes From afar, they are two tiny figures under the overarchin oaks and willows. They embrace and sink down into the dee grass beside the water. The leaves continue their unhurri course downstream.

dialogues.speaker: DRAGON COUNTRY
dialogues.text: A.cold wind whistles through the rocks near the dragon's lair. By the light of a flickering torch two workmen fini driving a heavy post into the ground. As they affix a pai of iron manacles they see the torches of a procession com up the slope. They hurry down to meet it. Horsrik is in t lead, followed by soldiers and royal attendants. Elspeth rides in the tumbril behind a blindfolded horse. Bringing the rear is Tyrian. At last the cart can go no further. Elspeth alights and leads the rest of the troop to the po As the soldiers put the irons around her wrists, Horsrik Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca unrolls a parchment, turns his back on the wind and begi to read:

dialogues.speaker: HORSRIK
dialogues.text: Now be it known throughout the kingdom, that the Princess, having been chosen by a deed of fortune and destiny вЂ” Horsrik blinks. There's a black stain growing in the midd of the parchment; all at once it bursts into flames. He c out and flings the document away. There follows a flash o light and a puff of smoke and Galen is standing there, as he had materialized out of thin air. Horsrik and his star men backpedal down the slope.

dialogues.speaker: HORSRIK
dialogues.text: No fire, | beg you. Galen raises his hands in a menacing gesture.

dialogues.speaker: GALEN
dialogues.text: Be gone! That's enough for Horsrik and company: he and the soldier depart.

dialogues.speaker: HORSRIK
dialogues.text: (over his shoulder) | declare these proceedings duly ordained... Only one man remains behind the challenge the young sorce Tyrian. He draws his sword.

dialogues.speaker: TYRIAN
dialogues.text: | knew I'd find you here. Well, I'm not as sentimental as some. The kingdom, every one of us, need this sacrifice. If you intend to interfere, you'll have to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: GALEN
dialogues.text: I've got plenty of reasons to kill you that have nothing to do with Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  this sacrifice. Galen draws his own sword. As it emerges into the night a it seems imbued with a blue phosphorescence.

dialogues.speaker: TYRIAN
dialogues.text: Most impressive. Can you use it? Elspeth twists around in her chains.

dialogues.speaker: ELSPETH
dialogues.text: Let it be! Please! Tyrian is right вЂ” it's our only hope! Galen starts to reply, but as soon as his attention waver Tyrian is lunging toward him, sword point directed at his neck. Galen barely manages to parry the thrust before Tyr is at him again, blade swinging toward his knees. Galen d the tip of his sword to catch the blow. When the two stee edges connect, sparks fly. In a series of thrusts and cou thrusts, each accompanied by a shower of sparks, Tyrian b Galen up the mountain.

dialogues.speaker: ELSPETH
dialogues.text: Tyrian вЂ” both of you вЂ” run! Flee! It's coming! Sure enough, at that moment the earth gives out a low moa and undulates in a sickening movement. Vapors begin risin from the lair.

dialogues.speaker: TYRIAN
dialogues.text: In a trice! This is no swords-man. He might be right, for Galen turns and bolts across the s When he reaches the post with Tyrian two steps behind, he whirls and brings his blade down on Princess Elspeth's ch The chains part in an explosion of sparks.

dialogues.speaker: GALEN
dialogues.text: Run! Get out of here! The Princess darts from the piling as Tyrian swoops down continue the attack. Galen dodges and the stake catches Tyrian's blow. The earth shakes again. Galen glances at t Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  Princess.

dialogues.speaker: GALEN
dialogues.text: No! Stop! What are you doing? Elspeth is not running away down the mountain. Instead sh is walking, slowly and deliberately, right into the smoki cave. Swoosh! Tyrian's sword comes down again. The dismay sorcerer ducks back and Tyrian's blade again bites deep i the wood.

dialogues.speaker: TYRIAN
dialogues.text: You've failed, my friend, and | thank the gods for it. Come out from behind that post. It's now or never. Elspeth is no longer in sight. Galen g his teeth, grasps the sword with two hands and swings it hard as he can ina wide arc. The blade never even slows down as it sails right through the post, lopping it clean off. The glowing sword flashes above Galen's head and eag buries itself in Tyrian's chest. The King's man is as sta by the amputated piling as he is by his own death. His ey roll up in his head, his knees buckle and he topples back the blade sliding free.

dialogues.speaker: DRAGON'S LAIR
dialogues.text: Smoke swirls at the mouth of the cave as Galen enters, ho his sword before him, lighting his way with its faint blu glow.

dialogues.speaker: GALEN
dialogues.text: Elspeth! The floor of the cave as it winds down into the mountain paved first with rock, then with dragon scales, then with bones. With each footfall, clusters of mysterious insects scuttle away. Galen pauses to mop his brow; it's getting hot. A sound echoes up from the depths, a grinding sound like the gnashing of teeth, followed by hissing and squea Galen grips his sword tighter and pushes on. Suddenly he stoops and picks up an embroidered slipper: Elspeth's. Th grinding sounds are louder. He hurries forward and rounds corner. He stops and gags. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two disgusting little reptiles вЂ” like scaly raccoons вЂ perched on the corpse of Princess Elspeth Ulfilas, feedin contentiously on choice bits of the royal flesh. Galen gr he lashes out and his sword beheads one of the tiny monst The other one buzzes its half-formed winglets and hisses hot stream of air. Galen brings down the sword and slices in half. Eyes riveted on Elspeth's remains, he edges arou the carnage and backs away. Hissss! вЂ” there's a third o lurking in the shadows, munching on something; it might b hand. Galen shrieks and jumps away. The little creature c at him and clamps its jaws on his leg. Galen stabs at it repeatedly. Finally it lets go, and flails and flops acro the bloody floor, ululating its death agony. As the creat last mewlings echo down through the cavern, the ground quivers. Bits of stone fall from the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: LAKE OF FIRE
dialogues.text: Galen works his way down a narrow passage whose walls are alive with insects and beads of sulphurous water. As befo he holds the sword in front of him; he marvels at its increasing brightness. The heat is increasing too; sweat mats his hair and runs down his face. A few yards further the sword starts pulsating. Now the walls take on a flick rosy sheen and the passage widens into an underground vis of staggering immensity: an underground lake, its surface bubbling and torn with sheets of flame. Arching over it i vault of stone, penetrated here and there by natural chim The dimensions of this internal world are unknown вЂ” the fiery lake disappears into half a dozen side chambers. Th one clear path is accessible only by a series of flat sto leading across the hot liquid. Galen grips his sword and resolutely hops from rock to rock.

dialogues.speaker: VERMITHRAX
dialogues.text: He's halfway across when the earth rumbles and the steppi stones teeter beneath his feet. A fiery wave washes over legs, leaving his boots smoking. Another tremor knocks Ga to his knees. As he scrabbles to pick up his sword and sh the great head of Vermithrax rises up out of the depths o Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca its long neck. It gazes at him through huge pale eyes un armored lids. A tongue flicks out and runs around its lip mouth. The head sways from side to side. The mouth hinges open, the nostriHike igniters come on and touch off the jet of gas squeezed up out of its innards. A roaring tube flame engulfs Galen. He crouches behind his dragon scale shield which deflects the fire just enough to save his li The dragon pauses to take a breath. Galen springs to his feet, and bounds back the way he came, his skin and cloth singed. Flames lick at his back as the dragon lets fly wi a second burst.

dialogues.speaker: TUNNEL
dialogues.text: Coughing and weeping, Galen staggers up through the tunne nearly tripping over the body of one of the baby dragons. few seconds later, Vermithrax follows, squirming and claw its way upward. When it reaches its dead offspring it sur the scene with expressionless eyes. Bringing its head low it sniffs and nudges at the lifeless little ones.

dialogues.speaker: AMBUSH
dialogues.text: At that moment Galen leaps out from behind a niche in the tunnel wall and lunges forward. Striking sparks, the poin of his sword slides across the dragon's plated cheek and stabs deep between the scales of its heavy neck. There is unearthly shriek and the creature flicks its head back an upward. Galen goes sprawling and finds himself holding ha a sword. The rest is buried in the beast's neck, and Vermithrax doesn't like it. It flings its head this way a that, knocking rocks loose from the ceiling. Its movement cause the ground to quake. As boulders tumble around him, Galen drops to the floor under his shield. Dragon flame reaches through the cascading debris and washes over him.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: Valerian roams the rock-strewn slope not far from the dra lair. Presently she comes upon a once-familiar object вЂ” fire shield. Half the scales are gone, the rest are charr and curling. Grimly, she moves on. A few paces away she p up the blunted sword. She scans the rocks and finally see Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  what she's looking for.

dialogues.speaker: GALEN

dialogues.speaker: FOREST PATH
dialogues.text: Valerian and Galen trudge along side by side.

dialogues.speaker: VALERIAN
dialogues.text: How's your leg?

dialogues.speaker: GALEN
dialogues.text: Hurts. That thing was small, but its teeth were sharp.

dialogues.speaker: VALERIAN
dialogues.text: At least you killed it. You got all the young. This is small consolation, and Galen sighs.

dialogues.speaker: GALEN
dialogues.text: But the big one's alive. Somewhere down in that burning lake.

dialogues.speaker: VALERIAN
dialogues.text: Don't think about it. You had your fight, and you're still here. That's more than anyone else can say. Let's think about what lies ahead. She reaches out to take his hand. But Galen is no longer her side. She stops and looks back.

dialogues.speaker: GALEN
dialogues.text: Galen has come to a halt in the middle of the path. He's staring into the middle distance with a sudden inspiratio bubbling in his brain. He flings off his sack, drops to h knees and tears through the contents. Valerian comes back Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  baffled. Galen's gear is strewn all over the trail.

dialogues.speaker: VALERIAN
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Galen comes up with what he's looking for вЂ” the leather sack. When he replies, it is not to her, but to Ulrich:

dialogues.speaker: GALEN
dialogues.text: You old trickster! The burning water! The lake of fire!

dialogues.speaker: VALERIAN
dialogues.text: Galen, what are you saying? He regards her with astonishment.

dialogues.speaker: GALEN
dialogues.text: He had it planned. He knew this was going to happen.

dialogues.speaker: VALERIAN
dialogues.text: Who did? What happened?

dialogues.speaker: GALEN
dialogues.text: We've got to go back, | want to talk to him! He heads back down the trail, leaving his belongings on t road.

dialogues.text: Greil, a.k.a. Gregorious, stands in the center of the bur out granary, delivering a sermon. Behind him, men are fil the baptismal cistern.

dialogues.speaker: GREIL
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  The Church is mother to us all. Not just one lonely orphan who has lost his way, not just a few, but all of us that believeth in Him. When enough voices come together in prayer, He shall hear, we shall live and the beast shall die. In the gathering Simon ponders the hilt of his once fabul sword. With its blade shortened, it looks a lot like a crucifix.

dialogues.speaker: DRAGON COUNTRY
dialogues.text: Galen bounds up the rocky slope as fast as he can manage, trailed by a desperate Valerian.

dialogues.speaker: VALERIAN
dialogues.text: Galen, stop! Please, | beg you! But Galen pays no attention. In a burst of speed and fury Valerian comes up behind and tackles him.

dialogues.speaker: VALERIAN
dialogues.text: Stop! | won't let you kill yourself. Galen waves the leather pouch in Valerian's face.

dialogues.speaker: GALEN
dialogues.text: He couldn't walk вЂ” he knew he couldn't make the journey. So he had us make the journey for him! Don't you see? He jumps up and runs to the mouth of the lair.

dialogues.speaker: VALERIAN
dialogues.text: (pursuing) No! She tackles him again.

dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  All right, all right. You're going in there, I'm going too.

dialogues.text: (brought up short) What? Why? No you're not, this is my job. Absolutely not. But Valerian springs to her feet and starts into the lair

dialogues.text: I'm not afraid. And you're not going to stop me. After all - I've beena man longer than you have. Galen pauses long enough to snatch up a discarded torch n the remains of the wooden stake, then charges after her.
